plain: The user's favourite genre is likely to be literary fiction, as all three books fall under this category. The user's favourite kind of plot is likely to be complex and multi-layered, as all three books feature intricate storylines with multiple themes and character motivations. The user's favourite setting is likely to be a small town or rural area, as both "Ethan Frome" and "A Book of Common Prayer" are set in such locations. The user's favourite writing style is likely to be descriptive and evocative, as all three books feature rich language and vivid imagery. The user's favourite length is likely to be a novel, as all three books are full-length works. The user's favourite topic is likely to be the human condition, as all three books explore complex themes related to life, love, and loss. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be slow and deliberate, as all three books take their time to develop characters and plotlines. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be third-person omniscient, as all three books feature this perspective. The user's favourite themes are likely to be love, loss, and the human condition, as all three books explore these themes in depth.
